name: snuffly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
breathing in quickly and repeatedly through the nose, usually because you are crying or because you have a cold: I was a sickly, snuffly bronchial child. Wiping her eyes, she managed a snuffly laugh.
(of an animal) breathing in quickly and repeatedly through the nose while smelling something: Everyone loves hedgehogs, with their snuffly little noses and punky hairdos.
More examplesFewer examplesThe baby's a bit snuffly - I think it's his teeth.Her nose is slightly turned up and always a bit snuffly.It was the snuffly brown kind of bear that would come out of hibernation for peanuts.Some monsters are scary with pointy teeth and snuffly grunts.
